senses.sense_definition: Any of several chicken-like or turkey-like birds found in Australia and Southeast Asia that build large mounds of decaying vegetation to incubate their eggs instead of sitting on them.

examples.text: The <w>megapode</w> is unique because it relies on heat from rotting compost to hatch its young.
We watched a <w>megapode</w> scratching at the ground to maintain the temperature of its nest.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to or characteristic of the family of birds that bury their eggs in mounds for incubation.

examples.text: The biologist identified distinct <w>megapode</w> features in the fossilized remains.
This species displays <w>megapode</w> behavior by constructing large piles of debris for nesting.
